newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch stock market breaks monthly turnover record.
newsitem.headline: Dutch stock market breaks monthly turnover record.

text.p: The Amsterdam Stock Exchange said on Tuesday it had processed more than one million transactions this month, setting a new record level.
The previous record was posted last month, when the Dutch stock market settled 847,698 transactions.
The bourse said the new record was part of an uptrend which started some years ago, and which seems to be caused by increasing activities of private investors in particular.
In 1995, the Dutch bourse processed an average of 258,000 deals per month. This rose to 462,000 in 1996 and the average for the first seven months of 1997 will be more than 765,000.
